profile

public void profile()
             throws ConfiguratorException
Starts the actual profiling. Call this method first.

Specified by:
profile in interface IPAddressProfiler
Throws:
ConfiguratorException - Thrown if an error occurs during profiling, or if this peer has no "best" IP address (i.e. it is not connected to the network or has no network interfaces configured).

protected java.util.List getLiveAddresses(java.util.List addresses)

isLiveAddress

protected boolean isLiveAddress(java.net.InetAddress address)
Checks to see if an individual address is "live".

checkNATFirewalls

protected void checkNATFirewalls(java.util.List checkAddresses,
                                 java.util.List nonNATedFirewalledAddresses,
                                 java.util.List NATedFirewalledAddresses,
                                 java.util.List deadAddresses)
Checks a List of InetAddresses to determine if they are NATed or Firewalled. Returns three Lists: one of non-NATed or non-firewalled InetAddresses, one of NATed or firewalled InetAddresses, and one of dead InetAddresses that aren't connected to the public Internet. These results are returned as arguments. You don't need to instantiate instances for these lists before passing them in.

isNATedFirewalledAddress

protected boolean isNATedFirewalledAddress(java.net.InetAddress address)
Checks a single address to see if it is NATed or Firewalled by using a web version of traceroute.

chooseBestAddress

protected java.net.InetAddress chooseBestAddress(java.util.List nonNATedFirewalledAddresses,
                                                 java.util.List NATedFirewalledAddresses,
                                                 java.util.List deadAddresses)
                                          throws ConfiguratorException
Provides a standard way to choose the "best" address from amongst a list.of other addresses. This is "protected" so that subclases can over-ride it to figure out for themselves what "best" means.

Throws:
ConfiguratorException - Thrown if no acceptable address is found, or if an error occurs during the algorithm to determine a best address.
